content: Hi all. Sorry if this is the wrong place to ask this question. I was wondering what the current status and/or relationship between async/ .await, generators and this WG is. (In particular the remit of this WG seems to be async IO which looks like a specific restriction but might not be?)
(also coroutines, the topic seems like a terminology minefield)
@Markus Pfeiffer I would say that generators are something that this WG could pursue
but if we do so, it may also be worth spinning out a dedicated project group around it
it seems bigger than just Async, though async is a clear application
@Esteban KÃ¼ber and I have been talking about it
I was trying to wrap my head around what is available in rust right now and what wants looking at;
there's async/.await which produces futures and the whole infrastructure that comes with it
and then there's generators in unstable rust
there has been quite a lot of discussion on this topic over time
this lang team design note has some more notes, @Markus Pfeiffer

@nikomatsakis I see; I think I stumbled over this yesterday, my main problem likely is the lack of a "definitive" source. All understandable seeing as this corner of rust seems to be not as established as I had assumed previously.

I'll do some reading (and coding) and come back then; otherwise I shall be lurking on the zulip
